notes.text:
An update for ipa is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) is a centralized authentication, identity management, and authorization solution for both traditional and cloud-based enterprise environments.

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: ipa (4.6.8). (BZ#1819725)

Security Fix(es):

* js-jquery: Cross-site scripting via cross-domain ajax requests (CVE-2015-9251)

* bootstrap: XSS in the data-target attribute (CVE-2016-10735)

* bootstrap: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in the collapse data-parent attribute (CVE-2018-14040)

* bootstrap: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in the data-container property of tooltip. (CVE-2018-14042)

* bootstrap: XSS in the tooltip data-viewport attribute (CVE-2018-20676)

* bootstrap: XSS in the affix configuration target property (CVE-2018-20677)

* bootstrap: XSS in the tooltip or popover data-template attribute (CVE-2019-8331)

* js-jquery: prototype pollution in object's prototype leading to denial of service or remote code execution or property injection (CVE-2019-11358)

* jquery: Cross-site scripting due to improper injQuery.htmlPrefilter method (CVE-2020-11022)

* ipa: No password length restriction leads to denial of service (CVE-2020-1722)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.9 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: jQuery before 3.0.0 is vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attacks when a cross-domain Ajax request is performed without the dataType option, causing text/javascript responses to be executed.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Cross-site scripting via cross-domain ajax requests
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: jquery: Cross-site scripting via cross-domain ajax requests

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: In Bootstrap 3.x before 3.4.0 and 4.x-beta before 4.0.0-beta.2, XSS is possible in the data-target attribute, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-14041.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: bootstrap: XSS in the data-target attribute
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Enterprise Satellite 5 is now in Maintenance Support 2 phase of the support and maintenance life cycle. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Red Hat Satellite 5 Life Cycle: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/satellite.

Red Hat Virtualization 4.2 EUS contains the affected version of bootstrap in the packages ovirt-js-dependencies and ovirt-engine-dashboard. These packages are deprecated in Red Hat Virtualization 4.3.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: bootstrap: XSS in the data-target attribute

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: In Bootstrap before 4.1.2, XSS is possible in the collapse data-parent attribute.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: bootstrap: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in the collapse data-parent attribute
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Satellite 6.2 and newer versions don't use the bootstrap library, hence are not affected by this flaw.

Red Hat CloudForms 4.6 and newer versions include the vulnerable component, but there is no risk of exploitation, since there is no possible vector to access the vulnerability. Older Red Hat CloudForms versions don't use the vulnerable component at all.

Red Hat Enterprise Satellite 5 is now in Maintenance Support 2 phase of the support and maintenance life cycle. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Red Hat Satellite 5 Life Cycle: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/satellite.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: bootstrap: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in the collapse data-parent attribute

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Bootstrap, where it is vulnerable to Cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the tooltip data-viewport attribute. This flaw allows a remote attacker to execute a script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, which can lead to stealing the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: bootstrap: XSS in the tooltip data-viewport attribute
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat CloudForms 4.6 and newer versions include the vulnerable component, but there is no risk of exploitation, since there is no possible vector to access the vulnerability. Older Red Hat CloudForms versions do not use the vulnerable component at all.

Red Hat Virtualization 4.2 EUS contains the affected version of bootstrap in the packages ovirt-js-dependencies and ovirt-engine-dashboard. These packages are deprecated in Red Hat Virtualization 4.3.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: bootstrap: XSS in the tooltip data-viewport attribute

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A cross-site scripting vulnerability was discovered in bootstrap. If an attacker could control the data given to tooltip or popover, they could inject HTML or Javascript into the rendered page when tooltip or popover events fired.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: bootstrap: XSS in the tooltip or popover data-template attribute
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat CloudForms 4.6 and newer versions include the vulnerable component, but there is no risk of exploitation since there is no possible vector to access the vulnerability. Older Red Hat CloudForms versions don't use the vulnerable component at all.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: bootstrap: XSS in the tooltip or popover data-template attribute

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A Prototype Pollution vulnerability was found in jquery. Untrusted JSON passed to the `extend` function could lead to modifying objects up the prototype chain, including the global Object. A crafted JSON object passed to a vulnerable method could lead to denial of service or data injection, with various consequences.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Prototype pollution in object's prototype leading to denial of service, remote code execution, or property injection
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Virtualization 4.2 EUS contains the affected version of bootstrap in the packages ovirt-js-dependencies and ovirt-engine-dashboard. These packages are deprecated in Red Hat Virtualization 4.3.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: jquery: Prototype pollution in object's prototype leading to denial of service, remote code execution, or property injection

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: A flaw was found in IPA. When sending a very long password (>= 1,000,000 characters) to the server, the password hashing process could exhaust memory and CPU leading to a denial of service and the website becoming unresponsive. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ipa: No password length restriction leads to denial of service
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: ipa: No password length restriction leads to denial of service

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in JQuery. This flaw allows an attacker with the ability to supply input to the âHTMLâ function to inject Javascript into the page where that input is rendered, and have it delivered by the browser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Cross-site scripting due to improper injQuery.htmlPrefilter method
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: No supported release of Red Hat OpenStack Platform is affected by this vulnerability as no shipped packages contain the vulnerable code.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
